bill_title: to extend unemployment compensation benefits for former employees of Dakota Pork, Inc., of Huron, and of certain other businesses, and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend unemployment compensation benefits for former employees of Dakota Pork, Inc., of Huron, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 61-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding § 61-6-8, any person terminated by Dakota Pork, Inc., of Huron, who has not been reemployed for any period, and who has become an exhaustee, as defined by § 61-6- 38, is eligible for up to thirteen consecutive weeks of extended benefits. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred ninety-four thousand three hundred fifty dollars ($194,350), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Labor, to provide the benefits provided for in section 1 of this Act. Section 3. The Secretary of Labor shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 1999, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. Section 5. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend unemployment compensation benefits for former employees of Dakota Pork, Inc., of Huron, and of certain other businesses, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 61-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding § 61-6-8, any person terminated by Dakota Pork, Inc., Dakota Cold Storage, or Dakota Shag Service, Inc., located in Huron, South Dakota, who has become an exhaustee, as defined by § 61-6-38, is eligible for up to thirteen consecutive weeks of extended benefits. Section 2. The unemployment compensation fund created pursuant to § 61-4-1 shall be used as the source of revenue to provide the extended benefits provided by this Act. The payment of extended benefits shall be subject to the provisions of chapter 61-6. Section 3. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. BILL HISTORY 1/26/98 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 227 2/9/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/9/98 State Affairs Deferred to another day. 2/11/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/11/98 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 5.
